Text: https://t.co/adT93v4ASA  I share some of the lessons I learned from Bill Campbell.

Beautiful tribute to my friend, Bill. Thank you @apple. https://t.co/nP25n21W9M
@tomstandage favorite quote from Tom in our meeting today: "sitting is the new smoking".  Tom - thanks for visiting Numenta!

Networks are calling some results of voting today with 0 percent in. How does that work? @jdickerson please explain!
@CA2016 Hey Copa - looking forward to the matches. I purchased tickets. I've paid - but when do I receive tickets?
@cmwdotme @JeffCHawkins @edcolligan I remember making a limited edition of the transparent PalmPilot very early, but not the pink text!
@sventwit17 Can't believe you still use your Visor - that's wonderful!
RT @SubutaiAhmad: HTM Stocks caught early earnings related Twitter anomaly before $TWX stock tanked. The power of real time anomalies! http…
RT @SubutaiAhmad: Intrigued by HTMs? An early peek at a bunch of our research papers, in the process of being published.  https://t.co/YO4h…

#ddsweetsixty  getting ready for a big birthday week ... bring it on!

Highly recommend to SF folks to see this amazing opera next week. There are still a few tickets left.  http://t.co/e5Y1vRHWpf
http://t.co/Bu0qWoNBqZ congratulations to our partners @Cortical_io for releasing their amazing intelligent text technology on @AWS.

Don't forget to enter the (free) Numenta Sparse Super Bowl pool. You have until tomorrow:  http://t.co/IJh3vnU6SG
http://t.co/p7sNEthCm2  Learn about Numenta and have fun at the same time. Play our (free) sparse football pool.  Spread the word!
http://t.co/irxf0xuR78 good overview article on the landscape for machine intelligence
http://t.co/q5xGXAoNKl intelligent machines are getting closer
http://t.co/109MnwMa2f shows that existing "deep learning" systems are not like biological systems
http://t.co/AqNbodD2wU Congratulations to our friends at Cortical.io on their funding. We can't wait to do more together!
http://t.co/u8Rwh9ZNbG column by Kevin Maney - we need to still make big innovations in technology, not just incremental improvements.
http://t.co/kX5YxaTg0W interesting take on the question of whether AI is demonic
RT @Numenta: Path to #machineintelligence is flexibility, learning from the brain, open collaboration. Read new @Numenta paper http://t.co/…
Come to our Workshop if you are technical and want to learn the latest! http://t.co/RkVC1OflwS
Fascinating exploration of how HTM might be applied to economic development  http://t.co/yT3MHJ9lT2
http://t.co/BKSqHbJzAE talks about how our partner Cortical IO is applying SDRs and our technology to natural language processing
http://t.co/NV9j0JTwTw I'm so happy to see one of Silicon Valley's Finest going to play an important role in Washington @smithmegan
RT @womensaudio: Super interesting - who Invented the computer? And why we don't know the answer. via @ddubinsky @ComputerHistory http://t.…
I'm thrilled to be working with Celeste Baranski again!
http://t.co/Kv9dvgVuev Happy to be in great company in this article!
http://t.co/bZ5YwTLXtC Love this interview of Larry and Sergey by @vkhosla
We've posted two new jobs at Numenta. Send us some great candidates! http://t.co/CBTQNDt9Je
@MimoCT @Yale @darcykp @yalewomen Great Yale event today for entrepreneurs.
Read my blog about @bhorowitz new book at http://t.co/06DLv5auSi.  (It will cost you $.10 on @CoinTent ). Great book for every entrepreneur!
Try CoinTent micropayments at beta partner http://t.co/Yq4tIr8wqC. Select an Insider Exclusive article, then let us know what you think.
http://t.co/43dHYK8CY6 See my husband Len talk about why computer history is so important @ComputerHistory
http://t.co/JvV3bhraz2 listen to @leolaporte interviewing Jeff about, well, just about everything!
Kevin Maney's great article - how everything will have sensors and we will need better modeling to understand it http://t.co/evsdKdzekI
Hi all ... those tweets are not from me about the diet ... wish it was true!  Will change password ...
Long but fascinating article about Jeff, the state of artificial intelligence, and our work at Numenta: http://t.co/6typnGtGPd
http://t.co/d4prj6y00l We've just released our first product! If you use AWS, this is for you.  There's a free version so give it a try.
I've posted a new article on my blog, so now your investment in CoinTent can be used for two articles. Try it out! http://t.co/06DLv5rxUi
I've just posted a new article on my blog, so now your investment in CoinTent can be used for two articles. Try it out please!
Read my tips on philanthropy, and help us do an alpha test of CoinTent micropayments here: http://t.co/vpZ1eoQjZ7
I'm writing a blog now - drop by to check it out.  http://t.co/06DLv5rxUi
@chobani Thought you might want to check your manufacturing line! (This is real). Or, is it a new #biflavor? http://t.co/SETnB9F7GJ
Everybody in the world is at Whole Foods.
Computer History Museum just released the Apple II DOS source, an amazing bit (excuse pun) of history http://t.co/LDTfPyxMXZ
I'm thrilled to have the right to purchase health insurance without insurance companies telling me that I can't.  Thank you Obamacare!
Want to beta test our new product? Looking for AWS customers who will give us some feedback. Write ddubinsky@numenta.com.
@Colleen8185 colleen .. thanks for your kind words
Great interview of Jeff http://t.co/D8Ep883A9l
Went to the Exploratorium gala last night.  Wow - the new location is awesome.  Make it a must-visit for your next trip to San Francisco.
I’m  speaking at the @wtrmrk Entrepreneur Conference on  May 8th, designed to empower women & their businesses. http://t.co/dCYXREX9o1
For a new review of Palm history  http://t.co/6MoT9hPVGb  Although I may not agree with everything, he sure got some key points right!
http://t.co/TCWng4brjQ nice short video featuring Jeff that explains what we are doing at Numenta
http://t.co/wHqsooF4 Check out Numenta's sparse football bowl.  This is the most unusual pool you will enter this year.
Tell House Republicans to take action against gun violence http://t.co/9xx92VSs #EndGunViolence. Sign petition to show there are many of us.
Interest is growing in our work at Numenta:  http://t.co/I05hcSvu
Read http://t.co/Zee5KLCg for my thoughts about Sally Ride
Numenta just posted a great job opportunity in marketing: http://t.co/wRpig1ih. Spread the word!
First Uber ride... Very cool service... Gonna use this a lot
Kudos to Obama for evolving in the direction of liberty and equality ... and showing backbone and leadership!
First day as former-CEO - so far so good. Will spend all week doing the "hand-off" to Rami.
Love Facebook's organ donation project - brilliant!
@davidharvey Agreed!  Would love to see someone work on this problem.
We've put some info about our in-progress product on our web site. Take a look!  http://t.co/AKCSkJwu
Thanks to the Post for sharing my views on why our crazy health insurance system needs reform http://t.co/PLuheBSs
Susan B #komen shame on you
Mitt refers to his lady lawyer. Like it's rare! Aren't 50% of today law grads women? Does he say male lawyer? Does he say lady doctor, too?
Dined in the Dark last night - very cool experience. Learn about blindness, see static electricity, laugh plenty. http://t.co/DVFgzFRd
Finished the Sunday NYT puzzle with my husband - a rare, exciting accomplishment in our house!
@TheTechChat: still seems crazy to me .. just not the stuff that justifies gazillions of legal dollars .. proof that patent system is broken
@mkapor - Agree with Mitch - further, Apple actually copied this feature from the Palm Treo anyway, which their patent didn't anticipate.
Palm's Treo could dial a phone number from an email long before the iPhone. The patent system is nuts.
My hometown is featured in the Sunday NYT:  http://t.co/49Z1oc5y.  Hmm - golf as a way out of poverty. Not sure about that.
Apple's employee tribute to Steve-touching at points, great entertainment, but not as many personal stories as I expected. Reading the book.
See Moneyball ... data science meets Hollywood with a little baseball thrown in
Obama's best line last night: "Don't compare me to the Almighty. Compare me to the alternatives."
New book The Two-Second Advantage by Ranadive and Maney is worth checking out. Talks about data streaming and predictions.
Remember - follow @numenta to get company news - this stream will turn into my personal one.  Feel free to unfollow (no hard feelings!)
Dusting off the official Numenta Twitter account for our upcoming beta. Follow @numenta to stay up on latest company news.
We're looking for a talented user experience person on a contract basis - pass this along! http://t.co/JJQQ4s5
Check out our first product manager position - help us design an amazing product!  http://t.co/D8ddPrv
Don't miss Jeff's talk at MIT - it's only ten minutes and worth listening to.  http://t.co/hJDiEJT
Engineers will enjoy reading Jeff's commencement address at Olin College last week (scroll past the goofy picture):  http://bit.ly/gC7eJy
Welcome to our new VP of Marketing, Joe Hayashi: http://bit.ly/4cxFn. First task: write a product plan!
Thanks to Akihiro Yoshikawa, who translated our HTM/CLA paper into Japanese.  See it here:  http://bit.ly/bSVFyv
Just posted a new job in product marketing: http://bit.ly/2czutU. Help us find someone great!
In response to questions, we’ve posted clarifications on our IP licensing position on Cortical Learning Algorithms:  http://bit.ly/gHbiKc
See our video of Jeff talking at Berkeley about the new algorithms; it's like the Beckman talk but slight differences: http://bit.ly/bSVFyv
We've posted a new version of our HTM paper, including a second appendix with details about the biology.  See http://bit.ly/bSVFyv.
We have posted detailed documentation on our new HTM cortical learning algorithms here: http://bit.ly/bSVFyv. Use Forums to give input.
We're working hard on documentation about our new algorithms - plan to publish before the end of this month.  Stay tuned...

We've posted a job for a senior software engineer:  http://bit.ly/2czutU   
Help us find great candidates!
We just released a refresh of our web site including updated algorithms info (BTW you must update your RSS feed for the forums)
Developer Gary has released a new version of his fun iPhone app - it tells you which celebrity you resemble   http://bit.ly/b0HP1r
Numenta has openings for paid interns - programmers and technical positions only - spread the word! http://bit.ly/2czutU
I wrote about Palm's amazing track record of innovation in today's San Jose Mercury News: http://bit.ly/a4X6TE
Korean version of On Intelligence just released - Jeff's book still going strong after being published 5 years ago
I just announced a postponement of HTM Workshop to 2011. However, we plan to release loads of info about the new algos this fall.
Vitamin D just did a new release and has a summer promo: if you haven't tried smart video, now's the time:  http://bit.ly/YPFKA
For a good chuckle, check out this British clip reporting on Vitamin D's smart video product: http://bit.ly/bksWAI
We're sending a newsletter in a few days with some info on our new algorithms. Be sure to subscribe to the newsletter http://bit.ly/95HCBN
Our partner EDSA recently announced using our technology for anomaly detection for off-shore power plants:  http://bit.ly/cLrDdD
Jeff gave a preview of our new algorithms at the Univ of British Columbia.  You can watch it here:  http://bit.ly/auw7Ag
Vitamin D - nice press with some good example use cases (catch the dog walker not walking the dog!): http://bit.ly/bORdbQ
See a new Vision Toolkit network here:  http://bit.ly/5QTHvX.  It detects happy vs. sad!
Save the date!  Our next Numenta HTM Workshop is planned for October 7 in San Jose.
Developers - see these .net bindings for our web services API provided by asd.and.Rizzo - good stuff!:  http://bit.ly/4UzuMA
Developer Gary has released iResemble for the iPhone using HTM, our first mobile app! It's a lot of fun. Go to iTunes to purchase it for $1.
Vitamin D has just released an updated beta version of their smart video application. Be sure to try it out!
See what the LifeHacker site has to say about the Vitamin D offering here: http://bit.ly/1xqzjp
Interesting review of the Vitamin D beta at http://bit.ly/3CIrfK
Vitamin D has launched their public beta.  Be sure to download the software at http://www.vitamindinc.com.
Vitamin D's beta program for their smart video product is coming soon. It's open to everybody, so sign up now: http://www.vitamindinc.com/
Dileep and Jeff have authored a major paper just published about mapping HTM to biology.  Find the paper here:  http://bit.ly/WHmDa
New wiki page to showcase vision networks developed by members of the community:  http://bit.ly/2I574a
Be sure to watch Vitamin D's video: http://bit.ly/15i3v0
Just did demos with Vitamin D at DemoFall - search Twitter using Numenta for reactions - great job by Jamie and Rob!
Come see Numenta and Vitamin D at the Demo Fall conference: http://demo.com/
Developer Gary has posted an interesting HTM network to detect forest fires, see http://bit.ly/47rHt8 or a video here http://bit.ly/TQmz3.
Check out our new release - a better Vision Toolkit and a new people tracking video demo
Interesting user networks are posted at our forum here:  http://bit.ly/A9CIU. Be sure to click through to page 3 for the latest.
Japanese developers should check out http://numentawatch.com/ by Yoshimi Kikuya ... well done!
HTM Workshop survey - 80% of attendees rate the content as excellent or very good, and 93% say they would consider coming next year.
Check out this great video of a Numenta Vision Network experiment:  http://bit.ly/upW8
To Vision Toolkit users - thanks for the bug reports - they're very helpful - keep 'em coming!
400 people have downloaded the Vision Toolkit - we look forward to seeing your experiments, so be sure to upload them!
We're all exhausted but happy at the successful Numenta HTM Workshop. Lots of fascinating people in attendance - presenters did great jobs!
Dry run of presentations today - still work to do - good thing we only do this once per year ....
Final countdown before the Workshop - everybody is frantically working on presentations (and software, too).
Working on Vision Toolkit documentation - somehow this stuff seems both hard and easy at the same time.
Plans for the HTM Workshop in June coming along well - the agenda looks great - now we just have to finish the software!
I've decided to focus my Twitter account on Numenta after realizing that my personal tweets were pretty gosh darn boring.
